title: Georgia Judge Dismisses 2020 Election Case Against Trump and Allies
snippets: A judge in the southern state of Georgia rules that the case against Trump 'is hereby dismissed in its entirety'.
The historic Georgia election interference case against President Trump and allies for their efforts to overturn the 2020 election is no more.
The state charges were the last remaining criminal case against the US president stemming from the 2020 election.

A Georgia court has thrown out the lengthy election case, with the prosecution saying that pursuing it would not be viable. With it, the only remaining legal challenge over Trump's post-2020 election behavior falls away.
Georgia ends Trump election-interference prosecution Axios
Georgia's citizens are "not served by pursuing this case," the prosecutor said.
Fulton County Superior Court Judge Scott McAfee's ruling ends the final case against Trump that remained unresolved after he returned to the White House.
Trump wins dismissal of Georgia 2020 election interference case Reuters

A judge on Wednesday dismissed the Georgia election interference case against U.S. President Donald Trump and others after the prosecutor who took over the case said he would not pursue the charges, ending the last effort to prosecute Trump for his efforts to overturn his 2020 election loss.
Georgia case against Trump dropped, ending efforts to punish president over 2020 election aftermath AP News
titles: Georgia judge drops election interference case against Trump

summary: A Georgia judge has dismissed the state’s 2020 election interference case against President Donald Trump and his allies, following a request from the new prosecutor, Peter Skandalakis, who said pursuing the charges was not in the public interest. This decision ends the last remaining criminal case against Trump related to the 2020 election and closes all legal challenges over his post-election actions.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information about the legal proceedings related to the 2020 election, and the decision of the Georgia judge. However, it doesn't offer insights into the broader implications or context of this decision, or how it might impact future elections or the political climate.

title: Toronto Blue Jays sign pitcher Dylan Cease to a seven year contract
snippets: Right-hander Dylan Cease, who has made at least 32 starts in each of the past five seasons, has reached a 7-year, $210M deal with the Blue Jays, sources told ESPN.

The Toronto Blue Jays have made the first big splash of their off-season. Toronto and right-handed starter Dylan Cease agreed to a seven-year, $210-million contract on Wednesday, Sportsnet can confirm. The New York Post’s Jon Heyman was first to report the deal. It is the second-largest deal in the history of the franchise, behind only Vladimir Guerrero Jr.’s $500-million extension. Cease is coming off a down year in 2025 with the San Diego Padres, in which he posted a 4.55 ERA over 168 innings and 32 starts. However, his strikeout numbers remained among MLB’s best, as the righty punched out...
titles: Sources: Jays, Cease reach 7-year, $210M deal
Blue Jays agree to seven-year, $210M deal with Dylan Cease
summary: The Toronto Blue Jays have signed right-handed pitcher Dylan Cease to a seven-year, $210 million contract, according to multiple sources. This is the second-largest deal in franchise history. Cease, who made 32 starts last season with the San Diego Padres and posted a 4.55 ERA, is known for his high strikeout rates. The agreement marks a major move in Toronto’s off-season.
